{{Infobox battle item |name = Item Magnet |image = [[File:Bag_Item_Magnet_Sprite.png]] |caption = Artwork of the ''Item Magnet''. |price = 1,500 {{pdollar}} |location =
*[[Towns & Cities#Kanto|Lavender Town]] *[[Towns & Cities#Hoenn|LilyCove City]] *[[Towns & Cities#Sinnoh|Veilstone City]] *[[Shops#Poké Mart|Poké Mart]] *Chests in [[Dungeons|Dungeons]] }} == Description == The '''Item Magnet''' is a type of battle item. It temporarily increases the player's chance of gaining an extra item by 50% for 30 seconds. == Details == +50% Chance of gaining an extra item from [[Dungeons|Dungeon]] chests, and increases the chance of getting an item from Pokémon that drop [[Rare Hold Items]]. == Acquisition == ===Shops=== {{ItemPrice/head‎|Battle items}} {{ItemPrice|[[Shops#Kanto: Locations & Items|Lavender Town]]|1,500 {{pdollar}}}} {{ItemPrice|[[Shops#Sinnoh: Locations & Items|Lilycove City]]|1,500 {{pdollar}}}} {{ItemPrice|[[Shops#Sinnoh: Locations & Items|Veilstone City]]|1,500 {{pdollar}}}} {{ItemPrice|[[Shops#Poké Mart|Poké Mart]]|1,500 {{pdollar}}}} |} |} ===Dungeon Loot=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Dungeon !! 0 Clears !! 100 Clears !! 500 Clears |- |[[Mt. Moon]]||49.93%||49.52%||47.72% |- |[[Slowpoke Well]]||33.49%||33.24%||31.65% |- |[[Burned Tower]]||65.98%||65.30%||61.71% |- |[[Dark Cave]]||49.84%||49.35%||47.01% |- |[[Victory Road Johto]]||87.76%||86.39%||79.39% |- |[[Fiery Path]]||49.44%||48.73%||44.49% |- |[[Seafloor Cavern]]||47.78%||47.56%||45.90% |- |[[Oreburgh Gate]]||32.06%||31.77%||29.31% |- |[[Old Chateau]]||47.53%||47.19%||45.74% |- |[[Iron Island]]||63.49%||61.98%||53.74% |- |[[Spear Pillar]]||30.59%||30.38%||29.06% |- |[[Hall of Origin]]||48.56%||47.75%||42.37% |- |[[Relic Passage]]||33.12%||32.93%||31.28% |- |[[Chargestone Cave]]||39.47%||39.11%||37.22% |- |[[Reversal Mountain]]||61.78%||61.08%||56.82% |- |[[Cave of Being]]||16.61%||16.54%||16.20% |- |[[Connecting Cave]]||60.55%||59.88%||56.40% |- |[[Kalos Power Plant]]||48.73%||48.50%||47.35% |- |[[Team Flare Secret HQ]]||47.58%||47.19%||45.49% |} == Trivia == The Item Magnet shares the same design as the Magnet from the Pokémon franchise. However, unlike the Item Magnet, the Magnet is a held item that powers up the holder's Electric type attacks. __NOTOC__ {{Battle items}}
